reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just by chance our stay dates coincided with a special offer at this hotel £25pp B&B so decided it was easily worth a look .
reviews.title: oh dear !

reviews.text: Well we got what we paid for. Our room was clean and warm but very pokey with a bathroom in a decor i've not seen in many a year ! bright yellow suite and brown onyx style panelling ..yuk !
reviews.title: great night out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: overall this hotel is in need of a refurb .....worn carpets, tired decor. The bar may have been quite nice only peeked in there and the dining room overlooked a pretty garden with a view of the sea so that was nice.
reviews.title: relaxing break

reviews.text: so basically if you can get the special offer rates its ok but there are other places locally much much nicer eg The Spindrift .
reviews.title: Dated and poor service.
Great weekend
reviews.text: Stayed there recently over the December period. Great atmospher with very friendly and helpful staff. They run a dinner/dance every Saturday with their resident band - The Phoenix Four - who performed really well and had us all up ancing the night away. Highly recommended. It was great to get a traditional dance again including some good old Scottish jigs!!

reviews.title: Excellent place to stay
reviews.text: Well done Sandy and Eleanor on such a well run hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in a last minute decision to go away for the weekend - we decided to visit anstruther - part of scotland we hadnt seen much of. I looked up the special offer link on the symphony hotel website - and subsequently phoned up the hotel to ask if the offer was available - and it was!
reviews.title: great scottish hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: due to the dinner dance that was on - myself and my boyfriend could only get a twin room in the annex the first night then on the sunday night they gave us a lovely double room in the hotel with a gorgeous view. The second room was slightly more dated but we liked it anyway!
reviews.title: Dated and poor service

likes.liked: — the location in the East Neuk of Fife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The annex room was lovely - the place was spotless, the staff were so friendly and easy to talk to.
reviews.title: Over priced and mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was included in the deal - and we were given a 17 pound allocation per person per night for food - which was more than adequate! We thought the food was absolutely gorgeous and so fresh.
reviews.title: Only hotel in town, and it knows it

likes.liked: — Memorabilia on display in the bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We definately thought it was amazing value for money - anstruther is a must to visit - and the only place i would stay is the craws nest - such a great scottish hotel!
reviews.title: Fabulous Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our visit to this hotel which has enjoyed a very fine reputation for 30/40 years. Catering and service lived up to that standard but the room allocated explains as to why the hotel enjoys only a Three Star Rating. It was clean and well serviced but there was a strong cigarette odour which with New Government Legislation, you do not expect to find. The bathroom did not have an extractor fan and the wash-basin taps need attention.
reviews.title: Winter Warmer Break

reviews.text: I stayed at the Craw's Nest with my mother who uses a wheelchair. Though the food was good and the staff very friendly, I cannot recommend the hotel if your trip involves anyone in a wheelchair.
reviews.title: Dangerous for disabled
Brilliant Hotel
reviews.text: The disabled room is in the annexe, which is situated about 50 yards down a steep hill from the main hotel. The door for disabled access to the main hotel is on a narrow bend for cars entering the car park. The ramp is home made, far steeper than specified in the legislation. When placed over the small step there is a 3 inch gap at the rear. For all these reasons it is very difficult to pull someone in a wheelchair over this obstacle. Just one slip and they will go hurtling down the car par and career into the wall of the annexe.

reviews.title: The Happy Craw
reviews.text: In addition, the disabled room had a bath, no shower. Neither was there any form of heating in the en-suite bathroom, the bedroom generally being cold.
We checked out early, and will not return.
reviews.title: It's 1980 !
